page.title: 04HOUSING IN THE RHU AREA.
page.content: Characteristic of the housing of Rhu, Shandon and Clynder is the cottage and and villa style of building constructed of stone and slate set in quaint gardens .Another notable feature is the numerous mansion houses built mainly in the mid 19th century as family homes or country residences for the rich Glasgow merchants.These have long sweeping driveways,often lined on either side by mature rhododendron bushes,leading up to the main entrance.At the foot of the drives stand the lodge and nearer to the main house ,what would formerly have been servants' quarters and the stable block.Listed buildings include the Church,Rhu House on the main road and Ardenconnel House.The development of Local Authority housing in Rhu since the 2nd world War now accounts for 16% of all homes in the village.
